marketNews.title: US Inflation Above Expectations, Higher-for-Longer Narrative Strengthens
marketNews.content: US statistics bureau on Wednesday (12/2) local time announced that core inflation increased year-on-year in January 2025 and exceeded expectations. Here are the details: YoY Inflation: 3% (vs. consensus: 2.9%, Dec 2024: 2.9%) MoM Inflation: 0.5% (vs. consensus: 0.3%, Dec 2024: 0.4%) Core Inflation YoY: 3.3% (vs. consensus: 3.1%, Dec 2024: 3.2%) Core Inflation MoM: 0.4% (vs. consensus: 0.3%, Dec 2024: 0.2%). This development strengthens the higher-for-longer narrative, especially with the risk of trade war escalation. Before the inflation data release, US President Donald Trump said there would be an announcement of retaliatory tariffs for all countries that impose tariffs on the US. Additionally, Trump also announced a 25% tariff on all steel and aluminum imports to the US. The release of this inflation data came just one day after the Fed Head, Jerome Powell, said in testimony to the US Senate that the Fed is in no hurry to cut interest rates, given the current strong economy with low unemployment and inflation remaining above the 2% target. Powell also mentioned that reducing interest rates too quickly or too much could hinder disinflation progress, reaffirming the Fed's position when holding interest rates steady at the January 2025 meeting. Based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool as of Thursday (13/2), the probability of the Fed cutting US interest rates by more than 25 bps during 2025 fell to only 35.2%, from the previous level of 58.1% on February 6, 2025. Following the release of the inflation data, the US Dollar Index (DXY) briefly increased by +0.05% to the 107.97 level, before closing down -0.39% at the 107.55 level. Meanwhile, the 10-year US government bond yield also increased by +9 bps to the 4.62% level. The US stock market indices closed mixed, with the Dow Jones Index -0.50%, S&P 500 -0.27%, and Nasdaq +0.12%. In Indonesia, the IHSG closed weaker by -0.48% on Thursday (13/2), with the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield rising +1 bps to the 6.63% level and the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar strengthening +0.17% to 16,368 rupiah.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: BI Rate Cut Expectation and Short-Term Bond Investment
marketNews.content: Despite the decreasing expectation for a US interest rate cut, the Bloomberg consensus still expects Bank Indonesia to cut the BI Rate by another 50 bps to the 5.25% level by the end of 2025. Previously, Bank Indonesia unexpectedly cut the BI Rate by 25 bps to the 5.75% level in January 2025 amid a weakening rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar. This decision was taken to encourage economic growth amidst weakening consumption, employment, investment, and exports. This development re-emphasizes that volatility from economic data developments will always exist. With the interest rate cut outlook and future uncertainty, investors can lock in short-term FR bond yields that offer attractive risk-reward with lower volatility risk compared to long-term bonds. Some short-term FRs that can be considered are PBS032 and PBS003, which offer yields in the range of 6.3-6.45% with maturities around 1.5-2 years. *This article was released as Stockbit Commentary on Thursday (13/2) morning.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Government Seeks New Deals Amid Rising US Protectionism
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of Trade, Dyah Roro Esti Widya Putri, told Bloomberg on Wednesday (12/2) that the government is striving to diversify Indonesia's export markets as US protectionism increases. Although there is no indication that the US will impose import tariffs on Indonesia, Roro stated that Indonesia will diversify its export markets to Asia, Africa, and Europe if the US government imposes tariffs on Indonesia. Roro explained that the Indonesian government is actively negotiating trade agreements and bilateral cooperation to expand export markets. Roro also mentioned that Indonesian officials will meet with the US ambassador next week, although she did not elaborate further.

marketNews.title: China's Processed Nickel Exports Projected to Triple in 2025 Due to Domestic Overcapacity
marketNews.content: Commodity analysis firm, Mysteel Global, projects that China's processed nickel exports will increase almost 3-fold in 2025 due to domestic overcapacity. China itself recorded net processed nickel exports of 25,000 tons in 2024, marking the first time the country recorded net processed nickel exports. For 2025, Mysteel Global estimates that China will record net processed nickel exports of up to almost 70,000 tons.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Economic Affairs Claims UAE's Emirates Global Aluminium Plans Nuclear Power Plant in Indonesia
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs claimed on Wednesday (12/2) that the company from the United Arab Emirates, Emirates Global Aluminium, plans to build a nuclear power plant with a capacity up to 5 GW in Indonesia. Furthermore, the ministry also stated that Emirates Global Aluminium postponed plans to help increase the capacity of PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium's smelter in North Sumatra to 400,000 tons per year due to high electricity prices and a lack of low-carbon electricity. Emirates Global Aluminium has not commented on this issue.

marketNews.title: National Food Agency Plans Raw Sugar Import to Boost Reserves Ahead of Ramadan
marketNews.content: Head of the National Food Agency, Arief Prasetyo Adi, said on Thursday (13/2) that the government plans to import around 200,000 tons of raw sugar to replenish reserves as prices rise ahead of Ramadan. Previously, BPS reported that the average price of white sugar in the first week of February 2025 reached 18,365 rupiah per kg, which is +5% higher than the maximum retail price set by the government. Throughout 2025, the government estimates domestic white sugar production at 2.6 million tons and demand at 2.84 million tons, while white sugar stock at the beginning of February 2025 was 842,000 tons. The government set an import quota for raw sugar for industrial purposes at 3.4 million tons in 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Plans Board Reshuffle: Current President Director to be Proposed as President Commissioner
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia announced plans for changes in its board of directors, with the President Director, Jahja Setiaatmadja, to be nominated as President Commissioner. Meanwhile, the Deputy President Director, Gregory Hendra Lembong, is proposed to become the President Director replacing Jahja. Director, John Kosasih, is proposed to become the new Deputy President Director. Additionally, Hendra Tanumihardja is proposed as a new director member for BBCA. Currently, Hendra serves as the Head of Banking Transaction Cooperation Solution Development Division at BBCA since September 2022. This plan will be discussed at the GMS on March 12, 2025.

tickerNews.title: UNVR's Q4 2024 Net Profit Drops 41% YoY, Full Year 2024 Profit Misses Expectations
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia recorded a net profit of 359 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-41% YoY, -34% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for the full year 2024 to only 3.4 trillion rupiah (-30% YoY), falling short of expectations as it only equals 90% of the consensus estimate. Revenue in 4Q24 decreased to 7.7 trillion rupiah (-5% YoY, -8% QoQ), causing the revenue for 2024 to drop -9% YoY to 35 trillion rupiah. The decline in net profit in 4Q24 was mainly due to the decrease in operating profit margin to 6.7% (vs. 4Q23: 10.2%, 3Q24: 8.7%).

tickerNews.title: PTRO Records All-Time High Backlog of IDR 64.3 Trillion in 2024
tickerNews.content: Petrosea recorded a contract acquisition value (backlog) of 64.3 trillion rupiah throughout 2024, marking an all-time high. This contract value was obtained from several sources, including a mining service contract with PT Pasir Bara Prima worth 17.4 trillion rupiah, a contract from BP Berau Ltd. for the Ubadari and Tangguh projects worth 4.6 trillion rupiah, and a contract from Vale Indonesia (INCO) for the development of the Pomalaa mine worth 2.8 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: DMAS Posts IDR 210 Billion Net Profit in Q4 2024, Full Year Net Profit Grows 10.2% YoY
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari recorded a net profit of 210 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-34% QoQ, -65% YoY). This result led the net profit for 2024 to reach 1.33 trillion rupiah (+10.2% YoY). Performance during 2024 was driven by: 1) revenue growth to 2.03 trillion rupiah (+5.8% YoY) along with an increase in revenue recognition to 1.78 trillion rupiah (+8.9% YoY) from industrial sector sales; 2) gross profit margin expansion to 69.6% (+63 bps YoY); and 3) net profit margin expansion to 65.6% (+260 bps YoY) along with the growth of other income (+41% YoY) such as interest income and gains from management activities.

tickerNews.title: ERAA Director Attributes Resignation of Four Executives Largely to Personal Interests
tickerNews.content: Director of Sinar Eka Selaras (ERAL), Andre Tanudjaja, stated that the resignation of 4 senior executives at Erajaya Swasembada was mostly due to personal interests. Previously, ERAA announced the plan for the resignation of the President Commissioner, Ardy Hady Wijaya, and 3 members of the board of directors consisting of Elly, Mitchella Ardy Hady Wijaya, and Keith Ardy Hady Wijaya. Mitchella and Ardy are children of Ardy Hady Wijaya, where Andre mentioned that they will focus on building the family business after stepping down from their positions at ERAA. The resignation plan of these four individuals will be discussed at the EGM on March 19, 2025.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Controller Increases Stake to ~50.37% Through Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: The controller of Solusi Sinergi Digital, PT Investasi Sukses Bersama, purchased ~6.08 million WIFI shares at an average price of 1,530 rupiah per share on February 11, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~9.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Investasi Sukses Bersama in WIFI increased from ~50.11% to ~50.37%.

tickerNews.title: CNMA Plans Share Buyback with Allocation Up to IDR 300 Billion
tickerNews.content: Nusantara Sejahtera Raya plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 300 billion rupiah. The buyback price cap is set at a maximum of 270 rupiah per share. This plan will be discussed at the GMS on March 24, 2025, with the implementation period expected to run for 12 months after obtaining shareholder approval.

tickerNews.title: KLIN Controller Changes Hands via Acquisition of 60% Stake
tickerNews.content: Klinko Karya Imaji announced that PT Samico Capital Utama Mulia has acquired ~784.5 million (60%) shares of the company from the President Director of KLIN, Anggun Satriya Supanji, at a price of 31 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached 24.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Samico Capital Utama Mulia will become the new controller of KLIN, and thus will conduct a mandatory tender offer for the company's shares.

tickerNews.title: MLPT is Studying Stock Split Rationale to Boost Share Liquidity
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Multipolar Technology (MLPT), Wahyudi Chandra, stated on Wednesday (12/2) that the company is currently conducting a comprehensive study regarding options to increase share liquidity, including a stock split. Wahyudi mentioned that this decision still requires in-depth study and that the company is in discussion with the main shareholder, Multipolar (MLPL).

tickerNews.title: MINA Plans Rights Issue of Up to 3.3 Billion New Shares for Working Capital
tickerNews.content: Sanurhasta Mitra (MINA) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to ~3.3 billion new shares, with a maximum dilution effect of 33.3%. The exercise price and ratio have not been announced, while the proceeds are intended for the company's working capital and/or capital participation in subsidiaries. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on March 21, 2025.

tickerNews.title: GGRP Plans Rights Issue of Up to 12 Billion New Shares for Low-Carbon Steel Business Development
tickerNews.content: Gunung Raja Paksi (GGRP) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 12 billion new shares, with a maximum dilution effect of 49.77%. The exercise price and ratio have not been announced, while the proceeds are intended for the development of the low-carbon steel business. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on March 24, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BPII Reduces Stake in MTWI by ~0.41% Through Share Sale
tickerNews.content: The controller of Malacca Trust Wuwungan Insurance (MTWI), Batavia Prosperindo Internasional (BPII), sold ~11.9 million MTWI shares at an average price of 151 rupiah per share during January 17-February 6, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~1.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, BPII's ownership in MTWI decreased from 87.27% to 86.86%.

tickerNews.title: WOWS Shareholder Robby Adijaya Increases Stake to 8.68%
tickerNews.content: A shareholder of Ginting Jaya Energi (WOWS), Robby Adijaya, purchased ~214.9 million WOWS shares at an average price of 50 rupiah per share on January 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~10.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Robby Adijaya's ownership in WOWS increased from 6.78% to 8.68%.
